sources.autograph: Paris, Conservatoire, MS. 1292 (for title and comment, see No. 189)
ms_copies_parts: Naples, Conservatorio. Two copies: 22.3.2, and 22.3.6, 'Quartetto no. 3 . . .'
Paris, Conservatoire, a parcel of copies (see No. 189)
sources.first_edition: (1778?), Paris, Sieber: Op. 27 no. 3 (for title, see No. 191)
later_editions: (c. 1785?), Amsterdam, Hummel: Op. 11 no. 3 (for title, see No. 191)
sources.modern_edition: 1953, Milan, Ricordi: Op. 27 no. 3 (pocket score: revised by Enrico Polo). Polo has added a fourth movement taken from the quartet Op. 22 no. 6 (see No. 188)

entries.notes: Op. 24 no. 5 of 1776-1778 ('opera grande') in Boccherini's autograph catalogue (for comment, see No. 189)

partial_notes: Page shows continuation of string quartets entry with movements 2 and 3, plus full bibliographic information for G.193
